item.title: Abbie add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "No tears in the writer, no tears in the reader. No surprise in the writer, no surprise in the reader." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Abbie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Abbie add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Picking five favorite books is like picking the five body parts you'd most like not to lose." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "I'm going to smile, and my smile will sink down into your pupils, and heaven knows what it will become." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A self is not something static, tied up in a pretty parcel and handed to the child, finished and complete. A self is always becoming." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Stefan Zweig
item.description: "Time to leave now, get out of this room, go somewhere, anywhere; sharpen this feeling of happiness and freedom, stretch your limbs, fill your eyes, be awake, wider awake, vividly awake in every sense and every pore." -- Stefan Zweig

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Two possibilities exist: either we are alone in the Universe or we are not. Both are equally terrifying." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Abbie add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "Your head is a living forest full of songbirds." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "It’s dark because you are trying too hard. Lightly child, lightly. Learn to do everything lightly. Yes, feel lightly even though you’re feeling deeply. Just lightly let things happen and lightly cope with them. So throw away your baggage and go forward. There are quicksands all about you, sucking at your feet, trying to suck you down into fear and self-pity and despair. That’s why you must walk so lightly. Lightly my darling..." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Abbie add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "...two thirds of all sorrow is homemade and, so far as the universe is concerned, unnecessary." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Abbie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare
